skill.name: docs-write
skill.description: Write documentation following Metabase's conversational, clear, and user-focused style. Use when creating or editing documentation files (markdown, MDX, etc.).
skill.summary: Write documentation following Metabase's conversational, clear, and user-focused style. Use when cre...

security_audit.summary: No code execution or network activity is present. Content is a writing guide and formatting checklist only. No data access or exfiltration patterns found.

content.value_statement: Documentation often feels formal, slow, and hard to scan. This skill gives a clear style and structure so your docs read like a helpful colleague.
actual_capabilities: Apply a conversational, user-focused tone for documentation
Structure docs with action-first steps and clear headings
Format UI labels in bold and code in backticks
Provide ordered command blocks for instructions
Flag common wording and formatting pitfalls
limitations: Does not run formatters like Prettier
Does not validate whether commands work in your environment
Does not provide product facts beyond the prompt
Does not create or edit files without user input

use_cases.title: Standardize doc tone
use_cases.description: Apply Metabase tone and structure while editing existing guides.

use_cases.title: Draft feature docs
use_cases.description: Turn feature notes into step by step documentation that is easy to scan.

use_cases.title: Improve help articles
use_cases.description: Rewrite troubleshooting steps with clear actions and friendly voice.

prompt_templates.title: Rewrite a paragraph
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite this paragraph in Metabase style and keep it short: [paste text]

prompt_templates.title: Create instructions
prompt_templates.prompt: Write step by step instructions for [task]. Include ordered commands and clear headings.

prompt_templates.title: Edit a full section
prompt_templates.prompt: Edit this section for clarity, structure, and formatting rules: [paste section]

prompt_templates.title: Advanced restructure
prompt_templates.prompt: Restructure this doc to lead with actions, add clear headings, and remove fluff: [paste doc]

output_examples.input: Rewrite this setup guide in Metabase style and add clear headings.
output: Lead with the setup steps before background
Use action based headings like Set SAML before adding users
Format UI labels in bold and code in backticks

best_practices: Lead with the action and follow with brief context
Use descriptive headings that state the point
Keep examples short and ensure they work
anti_patterns: Using vague headings like Environment variables
Linking with here instead of descriptive text

faq.question: Which formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: It is designed for Markdown and MDX documentation workflows.

faq.question: Are there limits on document size?
faq.answer: Very large documents may need to be split into sections for best results.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my editor or CI?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not run tools or CI jobs.

faq.question: Does it access my files or data?
faq.answer: No. It only responds to the text you provide.

faq.question: What if the output feels too formal?
faq.answer: Ask for a more conversational rewrite and shorten long sentences.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic writing help?
faq.answer: It follows the Metabase style guide and formatting rules.
